snippet: The Virginia Supreme Court ruled that the state attorney general does not have the authority to demand records of e-mails or grant applications sent by a climate scientist who taught at the University of Virginia.
abstract: Virginia Supreme Court rules that State Atty Gen Kenneth T Cuccinelli does not have the authority to demand records of e-mails or grant applications sent by climate scientist Michael E Mann, who taught at the University of Virginia; Cuccinelli has said he suspects Mann used fraudulent climate data to secure grants.
lead_paragraph: The Virginia Supreme Court ruled that the state attorney general does not have the authority to demand records of e-mails or grant applications sent by a climate scientist who taught at the University of Virginia.
